Nebula Documentation

Introduction

The Project

Nebula is a 3D game engine written in c++. The goal of the project is a develop a versatile and cross-platform SDK. The SDK is first being developed for Windows and Linux systems with OpenGL for 3D rendering. PhysX by NVidia is used for physics. The goal for future versions is to support additional platforms such as XBOX, PS3, and Android as well as other rendering API's.

The Author

The sole author is Charles Rymal.

Main Loop

  • Sequential
    • Modules are updated sequentially each execution of the loop
  • Multithreaded
    • There is no loop
    • Modules are updated simulataneously on multiple threads with appropriate sync points and resource managament
    • Threads are released upon application launch and each use their own loop to handle changing conditions and perform repetative tasks
